reference.title: What are the keyboard shortcuts and other accessibility features?

titlealts.searchtitle: Chat: What are the keyboard shortcuts and other accessibility features

reference.shortdesc: Accessibility features help users who have a disability, such as restricted mobility or limited vision, to use information technology products successfully. HCL strives to provide products with usable access for everyone regardless of age or ability.

draft-comment.p: The following table identifies how to navigate in the contact list when it has focus.imb_accessibility.dita

entry.p: Navigation action
Keyboard shortcut or action
To move to individual names on the contact list
Press the Up Arrow or Down Arrow
To select a contact or group on the contact list
Press the Up Arrow or Down Arrow
To expand a selected group
Press the Right Arrow
To collapse a selected group
Press the Left Arrow
To display a list of options for the selected contact
Press Enter
To start a chat with a selected online contact on the contact list
Press Enter to display the list of options and use the Up Arrow and Down Arrow to navigate to Chat and press Enter.

draft-comment.p: The following table describes how to navigate in the text chat window.

entry.p: Navigation action
Keyboard shortcut or action
To give focus to the text chat message transcript area, so that you can scroll through the chat transcript.
Press Tab until focus is on that user interface element.
To give focus to the chat message entry area, so that you can type a chat message.
Press Tab until focus is on that user interface element.
